column4: Hi guys. I'm still having a problem with my fstab. I only have read access to my partition. Here is the line in fstab I added: /dev/sdb6 /media/sdb6 vfat rw,uid=500,gid=500 0 0 is this wrong for read/write access?
not sure, thats what some told me to put in there
Again, I'm not real sure. It mounts and everything, just read only access
type 'id' without the quotes in a terminal and press enter
What are you looking for? Would you like for me to copy and paste the return?
ok, now do you have more than one user on your system or is it enough to just give this user access to the vfat partition?
ok, at the moment what does  'ls -ld /path/to/mount/point' return?
oh, you were having another conversation and I got confused, never mind :)
ok, just unmount it, and change the 500 to 1000 in your options, then remount
